Description: Pendant: an opaque yellow glass pendant in the shape of a segment of a sphere. Each of its three edges is outlined with a prefabricated twisted cord in grey-blue and opaque white glass. The ends of the segment have been drawn close together leaving a narrow opening. Apparently built on a metal wire which remains in place. The ends of this wire were doubtless originally looped but these details are lost. Its suspension loop is missing.
Curator's comments: For a virtual duplicate with loop preserved see 1939,0322.64. Bibliography: Sale Catalogue, Henry Salt Collection, Sotheby, London, 28 June – 8 July 1835, lot 618.
This object was probably discarded after manufacture: the inside of the remaining hoop has fused, so that it has become useless and could not be suspended.
